mapper.sql: com_type_id as comTypeId, `name`, `days`, extra, a_id as aId, create_time as createTime, update_time as updateTime
mapper.insert: insert into t_com_type (com_type_id, `name`, `days`, extra, a_id, create_time, update_time) values (#{comTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{name,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{days,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{extra,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{aId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})

insert into t_com_type
com_type_id,
`name`,
`days`,
extra,
a_id,
create_time,
update_time,
#{comTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
#{name,jdbcType=CHAR},
#{days,jdbcType=INTEGER},
#{extra,jdbcType=CHAR},

mapper.update:
update t_com_type
`name` = #{name,jdbcType=CHAR},
`days` = #{days,jdbcType=INTEGER},
extra = #{extra,jdbcType=CHAR},
a_id = #{aId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where com_type_id = #{comTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update t_com_type set `name` = #{name,jdbcType=CHAR}, `days` = #{days,jdbcType=INTEGER}, extra = #{extra,jdbcType=CHAR}, a_id = #{aId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where com_type_id = #{comTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
select c.com_type_id as comTypeId, c.name, c.days, c.extra, c.a_id as aId, c.create_time as createTime, c.update_time as updateTime, u.username from t_com_type c left join t_admin_user u on c.a_id = u.a_id
AND u.username like '%' #{username} '%'

select
from t_com_type order by com_type_id asc
